companies.company_name: Bank of NT Butterfield & Son Ltd

key_risks: Regulatory scrutiny in AML and KYC compliance
Economic sensitivity to tourism and international business in key markets
Cybersecurity vulnerabilities and reliance on third-party technology providers
Intense market competition in wealth management and private banking
Stock performance concerns due to potential overvaluation
controversies: Ongoing regulatory challenges in multiple jurisdictions
Potential reputational damage from cybersecurity breaches
social_issues: Economic reliance on tourism and international business, which can be volatile
governance_issues: Regulatory compliance risks in AML and KYC

sources.title: The Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Limited
sources.snippet: Performance. In 2023, The Bank of N T Butterfield & Son Limited achieved the position of 1st largest bank in Bermuda with a market share of 56.42%; its total assets dropped by 6.52%.. Additionally, the bank became the 2nd profitable bank in relation to its total assets showcasing 1.63% return on assets and 24.14% return on equity in 2023.
